meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a gypsy.
meanings.sent1: Her colorful skirt had a gypsyish flair.
meanings.sent2: The caravan had a gypsyish look with its vibrant decorations.
meanings.sent3: The gypsyish music made everyone want to dance.
meanings.sent4: His free-spirited nature was truly gypsyish.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious fortune teller had a gypsyish charm.

meanings.definition: Having qualities or characteristics associated with gypsies.
meanings.sent1: The nomadic lifestyle seemed gypsyish to the travelers.
meanings.sent2: Her adventurous spirit was quite gypsyish.
meanings.sent3: The gypsyish caravan traveled under the starry sky.
meanings.sent4: The old, tattered map had a gypsyish vibe to it.
meanings.sent5: The colorful scarves gave the room a gypsyish touch.
